subject: Re: [junit] unable to run the sample "AllTests"
msgSnippet: ... I recommend searching the web with Google for these kinds of problems. Were you unable to find a relevant page at Google? The AllTests class is not in
messageBody:
hdpoliya wrote:
> First, I am a fresh man in Junit. When I install junit, something wrong
> happened as follows:
>
> After I type
> java junit.awtui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> A Junit window pops up and at the bottom of it, there are red words:
> can not find class "junit.samples.AllTests "
>
> How can I solve this? I try put the junit home into the classpath, but
> it still does not work. What can I do?

I recommend searching the web with Google for these kinds of problems.
Were you unable to find a relevant page at Google?

The AllTests class is not in junit.jar. If you look in the directories
that were unpacked from junit3.8.1.zip, you should be able to find the
AllTests class. You should then know which directory to put in your
classpath.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info

2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
